thread.title: AL.com All-Access: End of the world as we know it if Alabama loses to Georgia
thread.title_full: AL.com All-Access: End of the world as we know it if Alabama loses to Georgia

author: Kevin Scarbinsky | kscarbinsky@al.com
title: AL.com All-Access: End of the world as we know it if Alabama loses to Georgia
text:
Comments 
The University of Alabama has been playing tackle football since 1892, give or take the Ears Whitworth years. 
Ditto for Auburn University, minus a few flag football teams put together by Terry Bowden, Gene Chizik and Gus Malzahn. 
In all that time, the Crimson Tide and Tigers have never combined to stumble out of the Southeastern Conference gate at the same time the way they're threatening to do this season. 
If Alabama loses to Georgia, the Tide will be winless after two conference games, same as the Tigers. It'll be the first time in recorded history both programs started the same season 0-2 in the SEC. 
Auburn has started at least 0-2 in conference play 11 times: 1934, 1941, 1944, 1946, 1948, 1950, 1952, 1954, 1966, 1980 and 2012. 
Alabama has started at least 0-2 in conference play seven times: 1947, 1949, 1951, 1955, 1956, 1984 and 1990. 
So no pressure, Jake Coker, but imagine the consequences if neither Alabama nor Auburn owns a single SEC victory after the first Saturday in October. 
We may witness an Iron Bowl without a championship on the line for either team for the first time since 2007. We might start looking forward to basketball season before basketball season begins. 
It's almost too painful to ponder. 
RELATED: Georgia will have Coker and a smile (Hollis picks) 
So, to borrow a sneaky motivational ploy from Pat Dye , you have to wonder. Is Alabama man enough to beat Georgia - and save the season for the entire state? 
If not, it'll be the end of the world as we know it. And, sorry, R.E.M., but we won't feel fine. Head To Head: Alabama vs. Georgia prediction Annice Deweese (45-15) and Kevin Scarbinsky (39-21) are back for the latest episode of AL.com's "Head To Head"! Check out their predictions for Alabama's must-win game against Georgia Bulldogs!
